intro: Dendropanax matudae, commonly known as the Matudae's tree-panax, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within montane forests. Its botanical features include small, clustered flowers and berries that are adapted to specific ecological niches. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
